name: Stakesby Lewis Hostel / YMCA
description: A hostel for African men in the 20th century and a center for cultural and political life.

name: District Six Museum
description: Preserves the memory of forced removals under apartheid and honors the displaced community.

name: Cairn of Stones
description: A site of remembrance where visitors place stones in memory of those displaced.

name: Peninsula Maternity Hospital
description: Maternity hospital that served many families in District Six before being closed under apartheid policies.

name: Vernon Terrace
description: An architectural landmark demolished during forced removals under the Group Areas Act.

name: Bloemhof Flats
description: Modernist flats that were the last occupied buildings before forced removals.

name: Homecoming Centre
description: A community space to reconnect former residents with the heritage of District Six.

name: Beinkinstadt Jewish Bookstore
description: Once a cultural hub offering radical literature and supporting local intellectual life.

name: Chapel Street Mosque
description: A longstanding mosque that served the Muslim community of District Six.

name: Spes Bona Mosque
description: Another important mosque in the area, representing the religious diversity of the district.

name: Star Bioscope
description: A local cinema that brought joy and entertainment to the community.

name: Avalon Bioscope
description: Another cherished movie theater remembered by many former residents.

name: Meeting Point
description: A communal gathering space for residents and organizers alike.

name: Historic Street Grid Remnants
description: Visible reminders of the original street layout before the destruction of District Six.

name: 1st Return
description: A symbolic site for the first group of families to return post-apartheid.

name: 2nd Return
description: Second group resettled here, continuing the legacy of community restoration.

name: 3rd Return
description: Third return site honoring displaced residents reestablishing roots.
